intro: Lepidaploa imeriensis, commonly known as the Peruvian dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its yellow flowers bloom in the spring and are followed by fluffy seed heads that disperse easily. Lepidaploa imeriensis is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
